revised_title: Surgical Treatment of Tendon Injuries: A Case Study on Stitching the Great Tendon
tldr: This article describes a case study of a patient who suffered a complete tear of the great tendon in their leg. The author, William Cowper, details the surgical procedure he used to repair the tendon, including the use of stitches and ligatures. The patient eventually recovered and regained full use of their leg. The article also discusses the historical context of tendon surgery and the various methods used by other surgeons.
